lead_paragraph: BRYANT--M. Travis, passed away on March 22, 2016 in New York City. Travis attended the American Boychoir School from 1952 to 1958. He appeared on the early TV series "Bonino" starring Ezio Pinza in 1953. He was a stage manager for Bucks County Playhouse and the New York City Prince Street Players. Travis joined The New York Times in 1980, retiring in 2006 as newsroom night supervisor. Travis, a lifelong composer, had written over 30 songs, plays and libretti, including "The Tower of Babel," "Genesis" and "Requiem for Our Mothers" with music by his father, Donald Bryant. Memorial Service Montclair Unitarian Congregation, 67 Church Street, Montclair, NJ, April 16, 2016, at 5pm. 1
